Mobile Gaming Market Regional Insights

The global mobile gaming market is studied on the basis of geography as North America, Europe, Asia-Pacific, South America, and Middle East & Africa. North America region dominates the global Mobile Gaming market in 2022. Mobile phone gaming is a thriving industry in the United States, and one of the largest game publishers is headquartered there. Some of the most well-known American publishers include Lion Studios, Imangi Studios, Ivy, Play365, Lowtech Studios, Roblox Corporation, i6 Games, DVloper, Oppana Games, and Niantic Inc. The United States accounts for 5% of all Google Play game publishers.

Furthermore, telecoms are working to determine how well their networks can support the demands of potentially billions of gamers shifting to streaming services. All three major US operators, AT&T, T-Mobile, Verizon, and T-Mobile have begun testing and developing services with cloud gaming companies such as PlayGiga, Hatch, and Microsoft Xbox Game Pass, including bundling deals that offer mobile data packages alongside subscriptions.

According to the global mobile gaming market analysis, the market growth in terms of revenue is expected to outpace that of the overall game market. Smartphones are transforming the video gaming industry by driving users away from large PC or TV screens and toward smaller screens. Mobile gaming is successfully disengaging a large number of players from console-based gaming to the small-screen driven gaming experience by allowing them to enjoy their games anywhere. Major gaming conglomerates are increasingly entering the mobile gaming market. The expansion of 5G penetration will boost game streaming providers. With cheap data and 4G networks, emerging markets such as India and Brazil are gaining higher ground in the mobile gaming industry.
